result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Wayne Huff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on AUGUST 26TH, 2022.

miscConds.notes: No Contact with Kohl's in Glendale, WI.

Defendant is to provide  a DNA sample by 5:00 pm on AUGUST 25TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.
Any cash bond on deposit to be applied.
Restitution set at ZERO.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Wayne Huff

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered Defendant to serve FOUR MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for FOUR DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on AUGUST 26TH, 2022

Complete 25 hours of community service.

No Contact with Kohl's in Glendale, WI

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

Restitution set at ZERO

Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

***Case recalled at 4:04 to address DNA specimen*** Same appearances.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 5:00pm on AUGUST 25TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

Defendant Kevin Wayne Huff in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Kevin Wayne Huff.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.


AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing to proceed.

Defendant Kevin Wayne Huff in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Wayne Huff appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
All parties appear via zoom.  Case calendared for Plea and Sentencing this date.  Defense requests adjournment to an in person date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kevin Wayne Huff in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense counsel asks for an adjournment to allow time to go over plea paperwork with client. 
Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kevin Wayne Huff in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Wayne Huff appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Calendar Call held.  Court vacates previously stayed bench warrant.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing by zoom.  Defendant is unable to appear by video and will appear at defense counsel's office at the next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .
Case in Court for Status confernce. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Calendar call scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kevin Wayne Huff in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Wayne Huff appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and offer and requests additional time to meet with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kevin Wayne Huff in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Wayne Huff appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional time.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohls Department Store - Glendale Loss Prevention and Rashaunda M Crayton

Defendant Kevin Wayne Huff in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Kevin Wayne Huff in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Wayne Huff appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
